item.title: Bomb Shrapnel Tore a Doctor Apart: His Experience Remade Him
item.description: When a spinal cord specialist suffers nerve injuries from an Iraqi bomber, he suddenly becomes the exact kind of patient he treats. The journey is rev...

item.title: Talk Therapy Less Effective in Young vs Middle-Aged Adults
item.description: Talking therapy for anxiety and depression is less effective for younger adults than for middle-aged adults, a study finds. Medscape News UK

item.title: Cyclosporin: A Viable Option for Severe Ulcerative Colitis
item.description: Cyclosporin is effective in achieving clinical response and remission in adults with severe steroid-refractory ulcerative colitis. Medscape News UK

item.title: AI Detects Missed Interval Breast Cancer on Mammograms
item.description: An AI system can identify high-risk areas on interval breast cancer screening mammograms and detect tumours that radiologists miss, a Swiss study show...

item.title: US FDA Approves Precigen's Immunotherapy for Rare Respiratory Disease
item.description: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration has approved Precigen's immunotherapy to treat adults with a rare respiratory disease, making it the first treat...
